channel.title: Distributed client
channel.description:
i don't wanna make server go public at this moment i wanna make sure everything iv did is perfect in from my point of view i was tryin get friend be able to connect to my distributed client(testing purposes), I just put the client and server 0.0.0.0 then put in distributed client but when i sent it he got a blank folder file?..If he was to get the files correctly idk why they were blank wouldn't he beable to connect with me on my server?
thanks,

item.title: Distributed client
item.dc:creator: @skarletdeath skarletdeath
item.description:
@skarletdeath wrote:

yeah i got it workin out of luck really what i did was put my computer i.p in server.java also put it in my client side then in distributed client i put my internal i.p address and portfoward i.p i put in server.java and it worked so im happy thanks ( = my servers peak is 2 online ftw ha

Read full topic

item.title: Distributed client
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

well, before sending it to him i suggest archiving it in either .zip or .rar format. Which I still dont know how someone could get a blank folder… anywho. Secondly, you need to change 0.0.0.0 to the ip adress that the server is running from. The ip 0.0.0.0 its localhosting (i think? i’ve always used 127.0.0.1 for localhosting.) like i said, just change the ip in the distributable client to the ip adress of the computer running the server, and all should work out great.

Read full topic
